definition: Chunfen or Spring Equinox, 4th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st March-4th April
spring (season)/gay/joyful/youthful/love/lust/life
surname Chun
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
the spring equinox

sentences.english: Why was the rising Sun due east one day after the equinox?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼是春分後一天太陽正好從東方升起？

sentences.english: We call the equinoxes spring and fall.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個分點，人們分別稱之爲春分和秋分。

sentences.english: The ecclesiastical "vernal equinox" is always on March 21.
sentences.chinese: 另外，基督教的“春分”通常是3月21日。

sentences.english: But he waited until one day after the northern Spring equinox, in 2001, to photograph the striking view.
sentences.chinese: 但他是等到北半球春分之後一天拍的，2001年。

sentences.english: Explanation: Twice a year, at the Spring and Fall equinox, the Sun rises due east.
sentences.chinese: 一年兩次，春分和秋分，太陽從正東方升起。

sentences.english: Twice a year, at the Spring and Fall equinox, the Sun rises due east.
sentences.chinese: 一年兩次，春分和秋分，太陽從正東方升起。

sentences.english: Yeah, we celebrate the Vernal Equinox and have a day off.
sentences.chinese: 對，因爲我們會過春分節，放一天假。

sentences.english: But I thought there was a better chance of seeing them around the time of the equinoxes.
sentences.chinese: 可是我認爲在春分和秋分前後看到的機會更多。

sentences.english: The festival occurs two weeks after vernal equinox.
sentences.chinese: 春分過後兩週即是清明節。

sentences.english: Time and the calendar begin on the equinox of 3/21.
sentences.chinese: 時間和曆法開始於3月21日的春分點上。

sentences.english: The vernal equinox, however, occurs when the center of the sun crosses the Equator.
sentences.chinese: 當太陽中心橫過赤道之時，便是春分。

definition: Qiufen or Autumn Equinox, 16th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd September-7th October
Xiazhi or Summer Solstice, 10th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st June-6th July
Liqiu or Start of Autumn, 13th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-22nd August
Xiaoshu or Lesser Heat, 11th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-22nd July
Chushu or End of Heat, 14th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd August-7th September
Winter Solstice, 22nd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 22nd December-5th January
solar term
Lidong or Start of Winter, 19th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-21st November
Mangzhong or Grain in Beard, 9th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 6th-20th June
Lichun or Beginning of Spring, 1st of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气[er4 shi2 si4 jie2 qi5] 4th-18th February
Dashu or Great Heat, 12th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd July-6th August
Hanlu or Cold Dew, 17th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 8th-22nd October
Shuangjiang or Frost Descends, 18th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd October-6th November
Jingzhe or Insects Wake, 3rd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 6th-20th March
the 24 solar terms, calculated from the position of the sun on the ecliptic, that divide the year into 24 equal periods
Lixia or Start of Summer, 7th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 5th-20th May
